newsitem.title: PERU: Peru posts 2.8 percent 1996 GDP growth.
newsitem.headline: Peru posts 2.8 percent 1996 GDP growth.

text.p: The Peruvian economy grew 2.8 percent in 1996, compared to 7.0 percent in 1995, the National Institute of Statistics and Information (INEI) said Tuesday.
The INEI added that year-on-year Gross Domestic Product (GDP) rose 8.5 percent in December 1996, compared with a 1.7 percent year-on-year contraction in the same month in 1995.
The figure was slightly higher than local analysts' expectations of around 2.4 to 2.6 percent growth last year.
It was also above the government's most recent, revised estimate of 2.5 percent, although below the initial official projection of between five and six percent.
The government projects five percent growth in 1997.
Annual growth was led by the agricultural sector at 5.7 percent, followed by fishing with 5.1 percent.
The worst performing sector in 1996 was construction, which contracted 4.6 percent.

Among other sectors, commercial grew 3.5 percent, mining 3.1 percent, manufacturing 2.6 percent, electricity and water 1.7 percent. The INEI's category for "others," including the transport, financial and government sectors, rose 3.4 percent.
